PLINTO API DOCUMENTATION - LLM-FRIENDLY COMPENDIUM
=====================================================

OVERVIEW
--------
Plinto is a secure identity platform API that provides authentication, user management, and session handling capabilities for developers. This document contains the complete API reference in a format optimized for LLMs and easy integration.

VERSION: 0.1.0 (Beta)
BASE URL: https://api.plinto.dev
DOCUMENTATION: https://docs.plinto.dev
SUPPORT: api-support@plinto.dev

AUTHENTICATION
--------------
All API endpoints require HTTPS. Authentication is handled via Bearer tokens in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>

Token Types:
- Access tokens: Short-lived (1 hour), used for API requests
- Refresh tokens: Longer-lived (24 hours), used to obtain new access tokens
- JWT format with secure signing

Password Requirements:
- Minimum 8 characters (Beta), recommended 12+ for production
- Case-sensitive
- Special characters allowed and recommended

BETA AUTHENTICATION ENDPOINTS
------------------------------

POST /beta/signup
-----------------
Create a new beta user account.

URL: https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signup
Method: POST
Content-Type: application/json

Request Body:
{
  "email": "string (required, valid email format)",
  "password": "string (required, min 8 characters)",
  "name": "string (optional, defaults to 'Beta User')"
}

Success Response (200):
{
  "id": "string (32-character hex user ID)",
  "email": "string (user email)",
  "name": "string (user display name)",
  "message": "string (success message)",
  "storage": "string ('redis' or 'memory')"
}

Error Responses:
400 Bad Request:
{
  "detail": "User already exists"
}
{
  "detail": "Password must be at least 8 characters"
}

500 Internal Server Error:
{
  "detail": "Signup failed: <error_details>"
}

Example cURL:
curl -X POST https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signup \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "email": "developer@example.com",
    "password": "securepass123",
    "name": "Developer Name"
  }'

POST /beta/signin
-----------------
Authenticate user and obtain access token.

URL: https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signin
Method: POST
Content-Type: application/json

Request Body:
{
  "email": "string (required, registered email)",
  "password": "string (required, user password)"
}

Success Response (200):
{
  "access_token": "string (64-character hex token)",
  "token_type": "string ('bearer')",
  "user": {
    "id": "string (32-character hex user ID)",
    "email": "string (user email)",
    "name": "string (user display name)"
  },
  "storage": "string ('redis' or 'memory')"
}

Error Responses:
401 Unauthorized:
{
  "detail": "Invalid email or password"
}

500 Internal Server Error:
{
  "detail": "Signin failed: <error_details>"
}

Example cURL:
curl -X POST https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signin \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "email": "developer@example.com",
    "password": "securepass123"
  }'

GET /beta/users
---------------
List all beta users (admin endpoint).

URL: https://api.plinto.dev/beta/users
Method: GET

Request Headers: None required

Success Response (200):
{
  "users": [
    {
      "id": "string (32-character hex user ID)",
      "email": "string (user email)",
      "name": "string (user display name)",
      "created_at": "string (ISO 8601 datetime)",
      "storage": "string ('redis' or 'memory')"
    }
  ],
  "total": "integer (total user count)",
  "redis_count": "integer (users in Redis)",
  "memory_count": "integer (users in memory)",
  "infrastructure": "string ('Railway')"
}

Error Response:
500 Internal Server Error:
{
  "error": "Failed to list users: <error_details>",
  "users": [],
  "total": 0
}

Example cURL:
curl -X GET https://api.plinto.dev/beta/users

HEALTH CHECK ENDPOINTS
-----------------------

GET /
-----
Root endpoint with basic API information.

URL: https://api.plinto.dev/
Method: GET

Success Response (200):
{
  "status": "string ('ok')",
  "message": "string ('Ultra-minimal beta API')",
  "version": "string ('0.1.0')"
}

GET /health
-----------
Basic health check endpoint.

URL: https://api.plinto.dev/health
Method: GET

Success Response (200):
{
  "status": "string ('healthy')"
}

GET /ready
----------
Comprehensive infrastructure readiness check.

URL: https://api.plinto.dev/ready
Method: GET

Success Response (200):
{
  "status": "string ('ready')",
  "database": "boolean (PostgreSQL connectivity)",
  "redis": "boolean (Redis connectivity)"
}

GET /api/status
---------------
Detailed API status and capabilities.

URL: https://api.plinto.dev/api/status
Method: GET

Success Response (200):
{
  "status": "string ('Ultra-minimal beta API operational')",
  "authentication": "string ('Direct Redis + Memory fallback')",
  "infrastructure": "string ('Railway PostgreSQL + Redis')",
  "endpoints": "array (['beta/signup', '/beta/signin', '/beta/users'])",
  "storage": "string ('Redis primary, memory fallback')"
}

ERROR HANDLING
--------------
The API returns consistent error responses with appropriate HTTP status codes:

Common HTTP Status Codes:
- 200: Success
- 400: Bad Request (validation errors, missing fields)
- 401: Unauthorized (invalid credentials)
- 404: Not Found (endpoint does not exist)
- 405: Method Not Allowed (wrong HTTP method)
- 500: Internal Server Error (server-side issues)

Error Response Format:
{
  "detail": "string (human-readable error message)"
}

INFRASTRUCTURE
--------------
Plinto API runs on Railway infrastructure with:
- PostgreSQL database for persistent storage
- Redis for session management and caching
- Automatic failover to in-memory storage if Redis unavailable
- SSL/TLS encryption for all connections
- Global CDN for optimal performance

Data Storage:
- Primary: Railway Redis (30-day user retention)
- Fallback: In-memory storage (session-based)
- Sessions: 24-hour expiry with automatic cleanup

INTEGRATION EXAMPLES
--------------------

JavaScript/Node.js Example:
```javascript
// Sign up a new user
const signupResponse = await fetch('https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signup', {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    email: 'developer@example.com',
    password: 'securepass123',
    name: 'Developer Name'
  })
});

const signupData = await signupResponse.json();
console.log('User created:', signupData.id);

// Sign in to get access token
const signinResponse = await fetch('https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signin', {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    email: 'developer@example.com',
    password: 'securepass123'
  })
});

const signinData = await signinResponse.json();
const accessToken = signinData.access_token;
console.log('Access token:', accessToken);

// Use access token for authenticated requests (when available)
// Note: Current beta API doesn't require tokens for user listing
const usersResponse = await fetch('https://api.plinto.dev/beta/users');
const usersData = await usersResponse.json();
console.log('Total users:', usersData.total);
```

Python Example:
```python
import requests
import json

# Sign up a new user
signup_data = {
    "email": "developer@example.com",
    "password": "securepass123",
    "name": "Developer Name"
}

signup_response = requests.post(
    'https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signup',
    headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'},
    data=json.dumps(signup_data)
)

signup_result = signup_response.json()
print(f"User created: {signup_result['id']}")

# Sign in to get access token
signin_data = {
    "email": "developer@example.com",
    "password": "securepass123"
}

signin_response = requests.post(
    'https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signin',
    headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'},
    data=json.dumps(signin_data)
)

signin_result = signin_response.json()
access_token = signin_result['access_token']
print(f"Access token: {access_token}")

# List users
users_response = requests.get('https://api.plinto.dev/beta/users')
users_result = users_response.json()
print(f"Total users: {users_result['total']}")
```

cURL Example Workflow:
```bash
# 1. Sign up a new user
curl -X POST https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signup \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"developer@example.com","password":"securepass123","name":"Developer Name"}'

# 2. Sign in to get access token
curl -X POST https://api.plinto.dev/beta/signin \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"developer@example.com","password":"securepass123"}'

# 3. List all users
curl -X GET https://api.plinto.dev/beta/users

# 4. Check API health
curl -X GET https://api.plinto.dev/ready
```

RATE LIMITING
-------------
The API implements basic rate limiting:
- No strict rate limits during beta phase
- Infrastructure auto-scaling handles high load
- Monitor response times and implement client-side retry logic
- Recommended: Implement exponential backoff for failed requests

SECURITY CONSIDERATIONS
-----------------------
1. Always use HTTPS in production
2. Store access tokens securely (not in localStorage for web apps)
3. Implement proper session management
4. Use strong passwords (8+ characters minimum, 12+ recommended)
5. Validate all user inputs on client and server side
6. Implement proper error handling to avoid information disclosure

DEVELOPMENT WORKFLOW
--------------------
1. Development Environment:
   - Use provided beta endpoints for testing
   - No API key required during beta phase
   - Test with real email addresses (verification not enforced)

2. Integration Steps:
   - Implement user registration flow
   - Add authentication handling
   - Store and manage access tokens
   - Implement error handling and retry logic
   - Test complete user journey

3. Production Considerations:
   - Monitor API response times and error rates
   - Implement proper logging and error tracking
   - Set up health check monitoring
   - Plan for user data migration if needed

CHANGELOG
---------
v0.1.0 (Beta) - September 11, 2025:
- Initial beta release
- Ultra-minimal authentication system
- Railway infrastructure integration
- Direct Redis storage with memory fallback
- Basic user management endpoints
- Health check and status endpoints
- LLM-friendly documentation

SUPPORT AND RESOURCES
---------------------
Documentation: https://docs.plinto.dev
API Status: https://api.plinto.dev/api/status
Health Check: https://api.plinto.dev/health
Support Email: api-support@plinto.dev
GitHub Issues: Contact support for repository access

FUTURE ROADMAP
--------------
Planned features for upcoming releases:
- OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect compliance
- Multi-tenant support
- Advanced user profile management
- Session management and device tracking
- Password reset and email verification
- Webhook notifications
- Rate limiting and API quotas
- Administrative dashboard APIs
- Audit logging and security features

API TESTING CHECKLIST
----------------------
Before integrating Plinto API into your application:

□ Test user registration with valid email/password
□ Test user authentication and token retrieval
□ Test error handling for invalid credentials
□ Test error handling for duplicate user registration
□ Verify user data persistence across requests
□ Test API health endpoints for monitoring
□ Implement proper error handling in your application
□ Test with different user names and email formats
□ Verify password validation requirements
□ Test infrastructure connectivity endpoints

For additional support or questions about integration, contact api-support@plinto.dev
